core_principles: Precision over Decoration: Every pixel must serve data clarity.
Hardware Tactility: The UI should feel like a physical extension of the reader.
Dark by Default: Optimized for low-light security operations centers.
Humanized Tech: Use common language (e.g., 'Card ID' vs 'ICCID') where possible, or offer tooltips.

structure: Top Bar: Hardware Connection Status (Always Visible)
Left Sidebar: Navigation (Sim Tools, Contact Manager, SMS, Clone, eSIM)
Right Panel (Collapsible): Live Activity Log / Hex Dump View

buttons.primary: bg-primary hover:bg-primary/90 text-white shadow-[0_0_15px_rgba(124,58,237,0.3)] uppercase tracking-wider font-bold
buttons.secondary: bg-transparent border border-border hover:bg-white/5 text-text_primary uppercase tracking-wider font-medium
buttons.destructive: bg-accent_danger/10 border border-accent_danger/50 text-accent_danger hover:bg-accent_danger/20 uppercase tracking-wider

cards.interactive: hover:border-primary/50 transition-colors cursor-pointer group relative overflow-hidden
cards.highlight_effect: Make the top border colored based on card type (Blue for Info, Green for Success, Red for Danger)

inputs.style: bg-background border-border focus:border-primary focus:ring-1 focus:ring-primary/50 font-mono text-sm

SimCardVisual.description: A CSS-only representation of a SIM card that flips to show technical details.
SimCardVisual.specs: Aspect ratio of a SIM. Gold chip contacts using CSS gradients. Rounded corner on one side.

HexViewer.description: A component to view raw data from the card.
HexViewer.specs: Monospace font, alternating row colors, highlight on hover.

ConnectionHeader.specs: Must look like a physical display on a device. Green LED for connected.

accessibility_rules.contrast: Ensure all text on dark backgrounds is at least WCAG AA (4.5:1). Use 'text-gray-300' not 'text-gray-500'.
accessibility_rules.focus_states: Visible ring-2 ring-primary ring-offset-2 ring-offset-background on all interactive elements.
accessibility_rules.aria_labels: All icon-only buttons must have aria-label.

types: Fade in for new data loads
Pulse for active hardware reading operations

universal_guidelines: DO NOT use generic gradients. Use solid colors or subtle noise textures.
DO NOT center text in data tables. Align numbers right, text left.
Always check for 'reader_connected' state before allowing Write/Clone operations.
